help_businesstype_giftshop_content:
**Gift Shops** are retail businesses. 

Customers are self-serving.

The business requires the following furniture to function:

* [Stack of Shopping Baskets](furniture-stackofshoppingbaskets)
* [Point of Sales](furniture-itemgrouppointofsale)
* At least one product to sell (see below)

Businesses of this type primarily sell:

* [Gift (Cheap)](products-cheapgift)
* [Gift (Expensive)](products-expensivegift)

And can additionally sell:

* [Arty Fish Smartwatch](products-smartwatch2)
* [Flower (Cheap)](products-cheapflower)
* [Flower (Expensive)](products-expensiveflower)
* [Picture Book](products-picturebook)
* [Rhythm By Tre](products-headphones01)
* [Soda Can](products-sodacan)
* [ZanaMan Smartwatch](products-smartwatch1)

Employees with the following skills can be assigned:

* [Customer Service](skill-customerservice)
* [Cleaning](skill-cleaning)
help_itemname_stackofshoppingbaskets_con:
**Stack of Shopping Baskets** are required in all retail businesses where the customers grab their products themselves.

**Customer Capacity:** 30

The furniture can be purchased from the following locations:
* [Square Appliances](address:16 4a)
* [AJ Pederson & Son](address:13 5a)
* [Essentials Appliances](address:16 11s)
help_itemname_cheapgift_content:
**Gift (Cheap)** is a type of product primarily sold from [Gift Shops](businesstypes-giftshop).

Additionally, it can be sold from:

* [Florists](businesstypes-florist)
* [Bookstore](businesstypes-bookstore)

The product can be placed in the following furniture:
* [Rounded Shelf](furniture-roundedshelf)
* [Product Panel](furniture-productpanel)

The product can be purchased from the following locations:
* [Metro Wholesale](address:2 5a)
* [NY Distro Inc](address:37 1s)

The product can be imported from the following locations:
* [JetCargo Imports](address: 1 pier)
* [United Ocean Import](address: 3 pier)

The product can be manufactured using the following recipes:
* [Gift (Cheap) Recipe](recipes-cheapgiftrecipe)
help_itemname_roundedshelf_content:
**Rounded Shelf** can be used to sell:

* [Gift (Cheap)](products-cheapgift)
* [Gift (Expensive)](products-expensivegift)
* [Flower (Cheap)](products-cheapflower)
* [Flower (Expensive)](products-expensiveflower)

**Product Capacity:**
* Gifts: 200
* Flower (Cheap): 40
* Flower (Expensive): 25
**Customer Capacity:** 15

The furniture can be purchased from the following locations:
* [AJ Pederson & Son](address:13 5a)
help_itemname_expensivegift_content:
**Gift (Expensive)** is a type of product primarily sold from [Gift Shops](businesstypes-giftshop).

Additionally, it can be sold from [Florists](businesstypes-florist).

The product can be placed in the following furniture:
* [Rounded Shelf](furniture-roundedshelf)

The product can be purchased from the following locations:
* [NY Distro Inc](address:37 1s)

The product can be imported from the following locations:
* [United Ocean Import](address: 3 pier)

The product can be manufactured using the following recipes:
* [Gift (Expensive) Recipe](recipes-expensivegiftrecipe)
help_businesstype_coffeeshop_content:
**Coffee Shops** are retail businesses. 

Customers are served by employees.

The business requires the following furniture to function:

* [Cash Register](furniture-cashregister)
* At least one product to sell (see below)

Businesses of this type primarily sell:

* [Croissant](products-croissant)
* [Cup of Coffee](products-cupofcoffee)
* [Cupcake](products-cupcake)
* [Donut](products-donut)

And can additionally sell:

* [Apple](products-apple)
* [Banana](products-banana)
* [Ice Cream](products-icecream)
* [Salad](products-salad)
* [Soda Can](products-sodacan)
 **Note:** A [Standing Digital Scale](furniture-standingdigitalscale) is required to sell Fruits and Vegetables.

Employees with the following skills can be assigned:

* [Customer Service](skill-customerservice)
* [Cleaning](skill-cleaning)
help_businesstype_fastfoodrestaurant_con:
**Fast-Food Restaurants** are retail businesses. 

Customers are served by employees.

The business requires the following furniture to function:

* [Cash Register](furniture-cashregister)
* At least one product to sell (see below)

Businesses of this type primarily sell:

* [Burger](products-burger)
* [Chicken Kabob Skewer](products-kabob)
* [French Fries](products-frenchfries)
* [Hotdog](products-hotdog)
* [Ice Cream](products-icecream)
* [Pizza](products-pizza)
* [Salad](products-salad)
* [Soda Can](products-sodacan)

And can additionally sell:

* [Apple](products-apple)
* [Banana](products-banana)
 **Note:** A [Standing Digital Scale](furniture-standingdigitalscale) is required to sell Fruits and Vegetables.

Employees with the following skills can be assigned:

* [Customer Service](skill-customerservice)
* [Cleaning](skill-cleaning)

help_businesstype_lawfirm_content:
**Law Firms** are office-based businesses. 

Customers are handled digitally and are not physically present in the buildings.

The business requires the following furniture to function:

* [Computer Workstation](furniture-computerworkstation)

Businesses of this type can sell:

* [Lawyer Fee (Hourly)](fees-hourlylawyerfee)

Employees with the following skills can be assigned:

* [Lawyer](skill-lawyer)
* [Cleaning](skill-cleaning)
help_businesstype_headquarters_content:
**Headquarters** are special businesses that can be set up in any office building.

This business type never serves any customers. Instead, it can seat all operational employees for an organization.

The business requires the following furniture to function:

* [Computer Workstation](furniture-computerworkstation)

Employees with the following skills can be assigned:

* [Purchasing Agent](skill-purchasingagent)
* [Logistics Manager](skill-logisticsmanager)
* [HR Manager](skill-hrmanager)
* [Headhunter](skill-headhunter)
* [Cleaning](skill-cleaning)

uncle_fred_tutorial_1: Hey, kid, I hope you're feeling better. Anyway, I talked with a friend of mine, Richard, he's kind of a big shot. Well, the bottom line is: he has a cheap apartment that you could probably afford. It's not much, but it'll do.
uncle_fred_tutorial_2: And I also transferred a couple of bucks to your bank account because I want to make sure you get something to eat. Okay. Promise me.
uncle_fred_tutorial_3: Kid. I've gone ahead and paid your first rent, but that's it, okay, you need to get out there and get a job. Anything at all. You just need a salary right now.
uncle_fred_tutorial_4: You got a job well done. You're a chip off the old block, just like your dad. I think he was probably just about your age when he started his first business. Look, if you need a loan to start something, I got a friend over at Jensen Capital. His name is Larry. That's who you ask for. And be sure to say hi from me your Uncle Fred. Okay?
uncle_fred_tutorial_5: You found the car. Good. Now, don't get any parking tickets. As I said earlier, it's time to pick up some stuff for your new store. You can use your new car or continue running around with the hand trucks. It's up to you.
uncle_fred_tutorial_6: Oh, very, very nice. Starting to look like a real store now. Next, we have to buy some things for you to sell. For the time being, you have to go to a wholesale store, but eventually down the road, you'll do a whole lot better by importing directly from a manufacturer or overseas.
uncle_fred_tutorial_7: Great work, kiddo. Now it's time to open up and start handling some cash, making some money. I'm crossing my fingers.
uncle_fred_tutorial_8: Well, look at you hustling around and stacking cash already. I tell you, your dad would have been so proud. I think it's time for your first hire. And don't forget to take that course at the Business Administration School so you know what you're doing. All right.
uncle_fred_tutorial_9: Well, look at who's the boss. You did a good job on that hire kid. I know having an employee takes a big cut out of what you're taking in, but it also gives you extra time. Time to start cleaning up these floors. Oh, man, they're a bit nasty.
uncle_fred_tutorial_free_car: So you're a gift shop owner now, huh? Yeah, very good. Very good. Now we've got some shopping to do. We'll get you some furniture and some really nice products to sell in there. And I also wanted to mention, I recently invested in a car dealership and we found kind of a wreck of a car in the workshop in the back, but it still runs. It's not much, but it's yours if you want it. The key is in the glove compartment.
uncle_fred_tutorial_11: Floors, looking good! Make sure you keep them clean. You don't want the customers walking around in a dirty store, okay. All right. Now back to business. Maybe it's time to start looking for other opportunities. By any chance, have you noticed that people, your customers, are looking for something to drink? How about stocking in a fridge or something like that with cans of soda? You can make some extra money on that.
uncle_fred_tutorial_12: There you go, kiddo. Continue listening to your customers and keep improving. Keep improving. And by the way, you know, you don't build an entire empire with just a gift shop, right? I think you should consider opening a new business. That said, you don't want to go rushing into something willy-nilly. You got to know what people want. There's an app for that. MarketInsider app. See what people are looking for.
uncle_fred_tutorial_13: Now, you know: in business we always research the market before we go into it, okay? Finally, before you start your next business, make sure you find a building with a high traffic index. Serving high demand products combined with an address seeing a lot of foot traffic means high revenue.
uncle_fred_tutorial_14: You got two businesses now, huh? Haha. I think that's what the media calls a serial entrepreneur. Very nice work. I'll let you get back to it and I'll catch up with you later, kid.
uncle_fred_tutorial_15: So did you get a call from the bank? They must be shocked to see what's happening with your account on the way it's growing. You should find yourself a nicer apartment and buy yourself some really nice furniture. You deserve it.
uncle_fred_tutorial_16: Hey, kid. I talked with a good friend yesterday. Name is Gary. He owns a drive in wholesale store down in the industrial area. They sell stuff in big chunks, but a lot cheaper. You should bring a car. It's too far to walk.
uncle_fred_tutorial_17:
Beautiful! Make sure to keep popularity high for all your businesses. Sometimes you might have to increase your marketing budget to gain the same results. The market changes every day.

I'm going to visit my vacation residence in Costa Del Sol. When I get back, I hope to see you have increased your daily income. It's time to take your empire to the next level, but we need more money first!
uncle_fred_tutorial_18: Hey, kid, you got to come see my new villa in Marbella. We'll drink some sangria together some day. It's amazing. Anyways, I'm glad to see you've figured out how to increase your profit. Our next move is all about cutting out the middleman, the wholesaler. We got to start importing our products ourselves.
uncle_fred_tutorial_19: Congratulations on your new headquarters! This is where the top employees of your organization will be seated. First, we have to start hiring. We need a Purchasing Agent to help us secure some import contracts.
uncle_fred_tutorial_20: Ahh, progress! Your first operational employee working from your brand new headquarters. Starting to sound pretty fancy, huh? Now we need to get your purchasing agent working. But first, we need a place to store all your imported products.
uncle_fred_tutorial_21: This is excellent. We'll use this warehouse to store your products until we can get them into your stores. We'll get back to that later. But now let's start stocking up these beautiful new shelves.
uncle_fred_tutorial_22: So your warehouse is just jammed with products. We're at the last part, getting that stuff out of your warehouse and into your stores. So let's get busy.
uncle_fred_tutorial_23: You're doing great, kid. I am very impressed. In fact, I think I should back off a little bit, give you more space so you can continue building up your retail empire on your own.

help_businesstype_webdevelopmentagency_c:
**Web Development Agencies** are office-based business.

Customers are handled digitally and are not physically present in the buildings. 

The business requires the following furniture to function:

* [Computer Workstation](furniture-computerworkstation)

Businesses of this type can sell:

* [Programmer Fee (Hourly)](fees-hourlyprogrammerfee)

Employees with the following skills can be assigned:

* [Programmer](skill-programmer)
* [Cleaning](skill-cleaning)
help_itemname_computer_content:
**Computer** can be used to set up a [Computer Workstation](furniture-computerworkstation).

The furniture can be purchased from the following locations:
* [Ika Bohag](address:50 4s)
* [Mr. Scott's Office Supplies](address:39 4a)
help_requirement_desk_content:
**Desks** can be used to set up a workstation for office-based employees. 
It requires a [Chair](furniture-chair) and a [Computer](furniture-computer).

There are different types of desks: 
* Standard Office Desk
* Executive Office Desk
* Standard Table

The furniture can be purchased from the following locations: 
* [Mr. Scott's Office Supplies](address:11 1a)
* [Ika Bohag](address:50 4s)
* [Lux Concept](address:68 5a)
help_requirement_chair_content:
**Chairs** can be used to set up a workstation for office-based employees. 
It requires a [Desk](furniture-desk) and a [Computer](furniture-computer).

There are different types of chairs: 
* Office Chair
* Stump Mesh Office Chair
* Regular Chair
* Multipurpose Chair
* Sommerhus Arm Chair
* Gammel Arm Chair
* Gaming Chair

The furniture can be purchased from the following locations: 
* [Mr. Scott's Office Supplies](address:11 1a)
* [Lux Concept](address:68 5a)
help_itemname_cleaningstation_content:
**Cleaning Station** is a special *employee station* that requires employees with [Cleaning](skill-cleaning) skill.

The furniture can be purchased from the following locations:
* [Square Appliances](address:16 4a)
* [AJ Pederson & Son](address:13 5a)
* [Essentials Appliances](address:16 11s)

dialog_bank_loan_accepted:
We can definitely help you with that. I'll have the full amount transferred to your bank account right away.
Thank you for doing business with us!

feedback_description:
Thank you for taking your time to help us make Big Ambitions the game we've all been dreaming about.

We actively use your feedback to prioritize what we should be working on next. All feedback is 100% anonymous unless you write your details in the textbox. Please leave all feedback in English only

Thank you!
Hovgaard Games

intro_paragraph_one: It’s been 3 months since grandma died. I know that I’m an adult now that I’m 18 years old, but still…
intro_paragraph_two: It feels so scary that no one is there to take care of stuff.
intro_paragraph_three: There’s one good thing though. At the funeral, my uncle Fred asked me for my phone number.
intro_paragraph_four: He said he wanted to help me get on my feet. I don’t really know him, but I guess he’s family after all.

help_common_hunger_content:
**Hunger** is one of the main properties of your character.

In order to improve the hunger status, you have to eat or drink. Consumables can be purchased in businesses around the city, or by stocking a fridge in your apartment or business.

When hunger reaches 0% it will have the following impact:
* Increased energy consumption by 200%
help_common_energy_content:
**Energy** is one of the main properties of your character.

In order to improve the energy status, you have to sleep or drink caffeine-containing drinks.

When energy reaches 0% it will have the following impact:
* Walking slower
* Risk of passing out from exhaustion
* Faster decrease of the hunger status

You can sleep on the following:
* [Standard Bed](furniture-bed1)
* [King Size Bed](furniture-kingsizebed)
* City Benches
* Vehicles 
* Boats
help_common_personal_goals_content:
**Personal Goals** are your character's side objectives. They are not related to the objectives given by Uncle Fred.

Achieving a personal goal gives a temporary **happiness** boost.

Personal Goals are directly connected to Steam achievements.

help_businesstype_florist_content:
**Florists** are retail businesses.

Customers are self-serving.

The business requires the following furniture to function:

* [Stack of Shopping Baskets](furniture-stackofshoppingbaskets) 
* [Point of Sales](furniture-itemgrouppointofsale)
* At least one product to sell (see below)

Businesses of this type primarily sell:

* [Flower (Cheap)](products-cheapflower) 
* [Flower (Expensive)](products-expensiveflower)

And can additionally sell:

* [Gift (Cheap)](products-cheapgift)
* [Gift (Expensive)](products-expensivegift)
* [Soda Can](products-sodacan)

Employees with the following skills can be assigned:

* [Customer Service](skill-customerservice)
* [Cleaning](skill-cleaning)
help_itemname_cheapflower_content:

help_common_happiness_content:
**Happiness** is one of the main properties of your character. The amount of happiness depends on the current boosts your character has.

Positive boosts can be obtained by:
* Having positive revenue
* Completing personal goals
* Achieving important goals (such as opening a headquarters, hiring your first employee...)
* Walking in the park
* Going to the skate park
* [Watching TV](common_watchtv)
* [Playing Computer Games](common_playcomputer)
* [Reading Books](common_readbooks)
* [Exercising](common_exercise)
* [Gambling (only on Friday evenings)](address: 4 pier)
* Relaxing on your boat
* Using a [DJ Booth](furniture-djbooth) in your home

Negative boosts can be obtained by:
* Sleeping in the car
* Not having an apartment
* Going to the hospital

When happiness reaches 0% it will have the following impact:
* Risk of entering periods of sadness
* Reduced employee happiness
* Faster decrease of the hunger status
* Faster decrease of the energy status

There are two types of periods of sadness:
* Period of not eating: you won't be able to eat anything
* Period of not leaving home/vehicle: you won't be able to leave your current home/vehicle or enter any building other than your home

help_skillname_customerservice_content:
Employees with the **Customer Service** skill are used for retail businesses.

Customer Service employees each work at any retail location's point of sale to serve customers.
They will also refill display inventory from storage shelves in the back

The skill level (%) defines how well the customers will be treated.

They can be assigned to:
* [Points of Sales](furniture-itemgrouppointofsale)
* [Coat Check (Left)](furniture-coatcheckleft)
* [Coat Check (Right)](furniture-coatcheckright)

They can be hired from:
* [Anderson Recruitment Corp.](address: 16 5a)
help_skillname_cleaning_content:
Employees with the **Cleaning** skill are used for retail businesses.

Cleaning employees each clean your store or office during the hours they are scheduled.
Note: Currently you do not see them cleaning.

The skill level (%) defines how much they can clean each hour.

They can be assigned to:
* [Cleaning Stations](furniture-cleaningstation)

They can be hired from:
* [Anderson Recruitment Corp.](address: 16 5a)
help_skillname_lawyer_content:
Employees with the **Lawyer** skill are used for law firms.

Lawyers each work with digital customers to earn their [Lawyer Fee (Hourly)](fees-hourlylawyerfee).

The skill level (%) defines how much customers are willing to pay for the services.

They can be assigned to:
* [Computer Workstation](furniture-computerworkstation)

They can be hired from:
* [City Workforce Inc.](address: 41 4a)
help_skillname_purchasingagent_content:
Employees with the **Purchasing Agent** skill are used for headquarters.

Purchasing Agents each manage 1 [import contract](importers-contract) and control [importing inventory](importers-overview) to your [warehouses](businesstypes-warehouse) or [factory](businesstypes-factory).

The skill level (%) defines how much discount they'll be able to get from the import contracts.

They can be assigned to:
* [Computer Workstation](furniture-computerworkstation)

They can be hired from:
* [City Workforce Inc.](address: 41 4a)
help_skillname_logisticsmanager_content:
Employees with the **Logistics Manager** skill are used for headquarters.

Logistics Managers each manage 1 [warehouse](businesstypes-warehouse) or [factory](businesstypes-factory) and control [delivering inventory](logistics-overview) to your stores.

The skill level (%) defines how many locations they can deliver to.

They can be assigned to:
* [Computer Workstation](furniture-computerworkstation)

They can be hired from:
* [City Workforce Inc.](address: 41 4a)
help_skillname_deliverydriver_content:
Employees with the **Delivery Driver** skill are used for Warehouses and Factories.

Delivery Drivers each are assigned to a vehicle in the warehouse or factory and will deliver goods to your stores at 02:00 (2:00 AM) based on the Logistics Manager's delivery setup.
Note: Currently you don't see them making deliveries.

The skill level (%) defines which types of vehicles they can drive.

They can be assigned to:
* [Warehouse](businesstypes-warehouse)
* [Factory](businesstype-factory)

They can be hired from:
* [Anderson Recruitment Corp.](address: 16 5a)
help_skillname_programmer_content:
Employees with the **Programmer** skill are used for web development agencies.

Programmers each work with digital customers to earn their [Programmer Fee (Hourly)](fees-hourlyprogrammerfee).

The skill level (%) defines how much customers are willing to pay for the services.

They can be assigned to:
* [Computer Workstation](furniture-computerworkstation)

They can be hired from:
* [City Workforce Inc.](address: 41 4a)

help_skillname_hrmanager_content:
Employees with the **HR Manager** skill are used for headquarters.

For every employee assigned to the HR Manager, HR will:
* Increase the employee's skill while they work
* Provide a temporary worker to cover the employee's shift if they get sick.
* Manage a [Health Insurance Plan](employee_demands_benefits_healthinsurance) from the [Hospital](address: 0 7s) for the employee

The skill level (%) defines how many employees they can handle and how much automatic employee training costs.

They can be assigned to:
* [Computer Workstation](furniture-computerworkstation)

They can be hired from:
* [City Workforce Inc.](address: 41 4a)
bizman_hrmanager_settings_train_employee: Note: training is slower but cheaper and employees will keep working on their tasks
uncle_fred_tutorial_marketing: Well, let's get back to your businesses again, because you still have a lot to learn, kiddo. Things are going great. Oh, yeah. But there are a lot of potential customers out there who never heard about your stores. So it's time to start marketing.
uncle_fred_tutorial_totalprofit: Beautiful. Hey, make sure you keep the popularity very high for all your businesses. Sometimes you might have to spend more money on marketing to get the same results as you got before, because the market changes every day. And by the way, I'm planning to visit my home, my vacation home, in Costa del Sol. But when I get back, this is what I hope to see: that you've increased your daily income. It's time to take your empire to the next level, but we need more money first.

uncle_fred_tutorial_25: You're really getting the hang of this stuff. So I think it's time for you to move into some new territory: office-based businesses. It's similar to retail businesses, but it's important to consider what's in demand in your specific neighborhood. You know what to do. So do it!
uncle_fred_tutorial_26: Well, will you look at this? All these people all dressed up, sitting at desks, making money for you. And that saying, not too long ago you were just getting started. I tell you what, I think it's time for a little celebration. Now you can't go gambling within the city, but you're going to hop over the Hudson and get a cruise outside international waters. It might cost you a few bucks. But listen, you're not just a broke kid anymore.
uncle_fred_tutorial_27: So did you win anything? Look, it doesn't matter. Sometimes it's just good to spend some money for the sake of spending money, if it makes you feel happy. But now it's time to get back to business. Are you starting to feel a bit overwhelmed with all these people of yours calling in sick here and there, huh? Well, you need to hire an HR manager. They take care of all that stuff for you.
uncle_fred_tutorial_28: There we go. HR managers are like buying yourself more hours every day. Hey, kid, you got to excuse me. I got an important golf lesson. Haha. Go make some millions and I'll get back to you later.

main_menu_welcome_title: Welcome to Big Ambitions Early Access
main_menu_welcome_message: First of all, welcome to the Big Ambitions Early Access Program! We're a small and completely independent game studio trying to bring something new and unique to the management genre. Because you decided to buy our game, we can continue to pay salaries to our employees and carry on making the game better. Therefore: thank you so much, you're a rockstar! <3
dialog_doctor_start: Hi there! How can I help you?
dialog_doctor_too_young: We're currently not able to offer you any of our special treatments.
dialog_doctor_operation_explanation_1: Ahhh, it's you! Fred already told me to expect you. Nice to meet you. Alright, I'll cut right to the chase. What we're going to do so inject you with something called "BA-1003-0817",. I have to tell you, this isn't approved, certificated or even known by anything governmental. This is something very special, we like to keep out of the public eye.
dialog_doctor_operation_explanation_2: A few minutes after the injection, your body will start to revert your aging. Typically, we see our client's bodyage to decrease by 10 years.
dialog_doctor_operation_explanation_3: For every injection, the DNA blueprint becomes harder to design. This is why we have to charge you a little bit extra for every injection.

npc_expression_demand_music: I like when stores play music. It's awkwardly quiet in here.
npc_expression_demand_seating: Do they want us to sit on the floor? Wow...
npc_expression_demand_interiordesign: The walls and floors are so ugly here.
uncle_fred_tutorial_29: Oh. Oh. I didn't expect that many millions. I hope you already paid off that loan of $15,000 to Larry, huh? Anyways, you know having all of that money in the bank might feel good, but it's not that smart. Ever hear of negative interest? That means the bank wants money for holding on to your money. And second, you're gaining virtually nothing from all those millions. It would make a lot more sense putting your money into an investment fund.
uncle_fred_tutorial_30: That's a much better place for your dollars. Believe me, no rich man will ever leave a lot of money in the bank. Investment funds are the way to go. The money works for you, just like your employees. Okay. And on another subject, remember to take care of yourself. Focus a bit on your happiness. Life is not all about the accumulation of cash.
uncle_fred_tutorial_31: Good to see you with a smile on your face. By the way, I've been meaning to ask you, have you noticed a decrease in sales in the Garment District? You never know. Sometimes things go up, sometimes they go down. The best you can do is spread out your business. Spreading the risk we call it.
uncle_fred_tutorial_32: There you go. That's going to make your empire much less vulnerable to all these market changes that are possible. Anyway, now I got to get back to improving my golf swing. Hey, don't forget, I still got that sangria waiting for you at Marbella. See you later, kid.
uncle_fred_tutorial_33: Hey, kid, you know, if it's possible to cheat in golf? I got to get that, Richard. I can't beat him. I can't beat him. It's driving me nuts. Oh, by the way, he told me your valuation is skyrocketing. That's great. But remember what I told you about spreading the risk. The same goes for your investments. How about a little brick and mortar? I think you should start investing in real estate.
uncle_fred_tutorial_34: Will you look at that number, huh? Can you believe it? So much money. Remember the good old days when I had to pay your rent? You're probably beginning to realize that making money does not make you happy, right? It's perfectly normal. Life is not about making money. Life is about having a goal and enjoying the journey. Here's another goal for you that I'm sure will give you a challenge.
uncle_fred_tutorial_35: You know, I just made up that challenge. I never expected you to actually achieve it. You're amazing. Unstoppable, even. I'm starting to worry about my number one position on the billionaires list. Hey, don't get any ideas, kid.
uncle_fred_tutorial_36: 65 years old. Congratulations! And you start to wrinkle one of these days. But I'll still call you a kid. Now I'm going to give you the greatest gift of your life. So listen very, very closely, okay? People like us have access to things that other people don't. So go visit Midtown Hospital. Ask for a mr. Ternity. Tell them that you're interested in their extended warranty package. I got to tell you, it's a bit pricey. Something around $1,000,000,000, as I recall. A price that keeps on going up.
uncle_fred_tutorial_37: Feeling younger already, right? Kid, I'm afraid to say that I got nothing more to teach you. I am really very, very impressed by everything you achieved. And I'm sure you'll do much more in the future. So, look, I hope you'll come visit me like you promised in Marbella. I heard they're even opening up a new airport soon. Until then, take care, kiddo.

bizman_insight_help_traffic_index: Traffic index shows you how much "foot traffic" passes by your business. More traffic equals more potential customers. This index is based on location and can't be improved.
bizman_insight_help_marketing: Marketing indicates how much you are advertising your business to potential customers. This can be improved by running marketing campaigns.

Best wishes,

help_taxes_pay_item_content:
The IRS charges annual taxes based on the income you've earned that year from businesses and rent, minus any tax deductible expenses.

Taxes are due at the end of each year (60 days, by default), as long as you've earned enough money for them to notice you.

You will receive a text message from the IRS when your taxes are ready and you will have 20 days to pay them.

If you fail to pay your taxes in time, the IRS will begin seizing your valuables (inventory, vehicles, furniture) until your balance has been covered.

Your taxes can be paid by going to the following location:
* [IRS](address: 70 5a)
help_common_movement_content:
**Movement**

* By default, your character is controlled using point-and-click with the mouse and vehicles are controlled with the keyboard, but you can adjust these options in the settings.
* Hold shift to switch from running to walking.
* Press middle-mouse button to toggle auto-run.

**Interacting With Objects**

* To interact with an object, left-click on it.
* To pick up an object you have placed, right-click on the object. Then right-click (or shift + right-click) to rotate and left-click to place it back down.

**Pausing the Game**

* Press spacebar to pause or unpause the game.

**If you get stuck**
* If you are in a vehicle, call the Tow Truck from your Contacts app of your [BizPhone](general-bizphone)
* If you are on foot, click Esc > Options > Others > Unstuck

help_common_bizphone_content:
Your **BizPhone** allows you to quickly conduct business from wherever you are.

BizPhone Apps:

* **Persona** - check on your personal stats and goals.
* **Contacts** - call companies you've interacted with before, like the bank or recruiters!
* [**Rivals**](rivals-overview) - Monitor how well your rivals are doing and track any attacks/rivalries against you
* [**MyEmployees**](skill-myemployees) - Manage employee recruits, uniforms, company assignments, training, and satisfaction
* **BizMan** - Manage your business' schedules, pricing and marketing
* [**Econoview**](finance-econoview) - view your Loans, Investments, Last Transactions and Income Statements
* **Voogle Maps** - get an overview of the city and use Map Filters to highlight locations and set waypoints
* **MarketInsider** - get an inside look at competition, demand, import price index, and market events
help_finance_banks_content:
**Banks** can offer you loans or investment opportunities. Manage your loans and investments in the [Econoview](finance-econoview) app on your [BizPhone](general-bizphone)

**Loans**

The banks may be willing to loan you money if you are earning a steady income and aren't already borrowing too much from that bank.

In addition to paying back the loan, you will also be charged a daily interest fee, based on the size of the loan.

**Investments**

 Each investment option has a range of possible earnings that it fluctuates between each day.
* Low Risk investments will almost always earn money, but they will earn very slowly.
* High Risk investments can potentially earn money faster, but they also have a risk of losing money.

Visit or call either bank:
* [Jensen Capital](address: 17 4a)
* [Vantander Bank](address: 6 2a)
help_finance_negativeinterest_content:
**Negative Interest** is a weekly fee the bank charges you if you hoard too much money in the bank instead of spending or investing it.

Every Monday morning just after midnight, you will be charged a fee based on your current bank balance. This is unrelated to any loans or investments you might have.

To minimize this fee, spend your money on:
* Your Businesses
* [Investments](finance-banks)
* Real Estate
* Luxury Items
help_finance_taxes_content:
The **IRS** charges annual taxes based on the income you've earned that year from businesses and rent, minus any tax-deductible  expenses.

Taxes are due at the end of each year (60 days, by default), as long as you've earn enough money for them to notice you.

You will receive a text message from the IRS when your taxes are ready and you will have 20 days to pay them.

If you fail to pay your taxes in time, the IRS will begin seizing your valuables (inventory, vehicles, furniture) until your balance has been covered.

Your taxes can be paid by going to the following location:
* [IRS](address: 70 5a)

Marketing can be used to supplement your Traffic Index to increase your Promotion. Different building sizes will require different amounts of marketing, so you'll need to find the right combination of marketing for each business.

help_importers_overview_content:
**Importing to Your Warehouse or Factory**

Your [Purchasing Agent](skill-purchasingagent) manages inventory orders in the BizMan app on your [BizPhone](general-bizphone). The inventory you can order depends on your [import contract](importers-contract). 

**Choose types of delivery**

*One-Time:*
The agent will deliver the entered amount, regardless of the amount of existing stock in the warehouse or factory.

*Auto-stock:*
The agent will adjust the delivery amount to ensure the total warehouse or factory stock equals the target amount. If the target is already reached, no products will be delivered.

* *Example:* If you set a target amount of 500 burgers, but your warehouse or factory currently has 300 burgers, your Purchasing Agent will order 200 more so your total is 500.

You can select how frequently you want the auto-stock: every 1, 3, or 7 days.

**Ensure Successful Deliveries:**

In order to successfully receive import orders in your warehouses or factories at 02:00 (2 AM):
* Each designated warehouse or factory needs at least one [Pallet Shelf](furniture-palletshelf) with enough free space to receive the inventory
* Your import order total must also exceed the minimum purchase amount
* You must have enough money to pay for the order.

store_page_description_long:
Your bank balance is tiny, but your ambitions are big. 

With a little help from your uncle, you get an apartment and your first job. But then it's up to you to achieve success and take over New York City any way you like. 

Slowly build multiple small businesses, grow them into huge corporations, or carve your own unique path – the possibilities are limitless in this vast business sandbox. You've never played anything like this!

Go from a small apartment and public transport to luxury suites, fast cars and designer furniture. Put your money into investment funds and real estate. Succeed, fail, rebuild. But remember to take care of yourself, sleep and stay happy on your rise to the top.

Do you have what it takes to build your own empire?
store_page_description_short: [b]Big Ambitions[/b] is a revolutionary role-playing business sim. Go from nothing to the biggest entrepreneur in New York by opening small businesses or slowly building huge corporations any way you like.
store_page_paragraph_1: Go from nothing to the most prominent tycoon in New York. Start a business, work smart, make it thrive and enjoy your life. How do you want to be successful? How far can you push it? How long can you make it last?
store_page_paragraph_2: Start your own gift shop, supermarket, coffee shop, law firm, clothing store, liquor store, florist, and more. You decide what success is - whether it’s a single shop, a chain of fast-food restaurants, a huge corporation, or making millions developing websites.
store_page_paragraph_3: Take out a loan, rent a building, design the logo, renovate the store, get stock, manage your money, hire staff, and build your infrastructure. Soon, you may have to start importing products from the harbour and distributing them through a network of warehouses.
store_page_paragraph_4: A bigger business means managers. Hire HR Managers, Logistics Managers, and Purchasing Agents. They all need desks and computers, so you’ll need a fancy headquarters.
store_page_paragraph_5: Need a delivery truck? Travel to a dealer and buy one. Need food? Go to a supermarket, but make sure you have a refrigerator at home. Big Ambitions is a life sim where your character has to physically interact with the world to survive and succeed.
store_page_paragraph_6: Enter any building in New York and buy it. Go from a small apartment to a dream penthouse in midtown, a luxurious townhouse in Hell’s Kitchen, or a series of skyscrapers. Fill each with furniture that suits your style and standing. Invest your hard-earned cash in real estate to grow your empire. Take over the city piece by piece.
store_page_paragraph_7: Spend your wealth however you wish. Buy a big SUV, a speedy sports car, or the new luxurious Mersaidi S500. Maybe risk it all at the casinos or put your money into investment funds and reap the rewards.
store_page_paragraph_8: As you progress, you always need to ensure you get enough sleep and stay healthy and happy. Enjoy the journey, for as you grow older, you’ll discover that money can’t buy you time... or can it?
store_page_paragraph_9: Big Ambitions takes what you love about the viral sensation ‘Startup Company’ to even greater heights.

help_employee_demands_overview_content:
Each employee will have up to 3 demands. Meeting the demands will ensure the employee is satisfied, but if you ignore the demands, the employee will eventually resign.

Demands come in three levels of urgency:
* Critical
* Important
* Nice To Have
The higher the priority of the demand, the more impact it will have on the employee's satisfaction.

There are different demands the employees can have: 
* [Employee Benefits](employees-demands-benefits)
* [Environment Demands](employees-demands-environment)
* [Equipment Demands](employees-demands-equipment)
* [Schedule Demands](employees-demands-schedule)
help_employee_demands_benefits_content:
As part of their Wants and Demands, some employees will demand **Employee Benefits**

Employee Benefits include:
* [Gold Health Insurance](employee_demands_benefits_healthinsurance)
* [Silver Health Insurance](employee_demands_benefits_healthinsurance), or higher
* [Bronze Health Insurance](employee_demands_benefits_healthinsurance), or higher
help_employee_demands_environment_conten:
As part of their Wants and Demands, some employees will demand a certain environment.
* Clean work environment: Building with a cleanliness of at least 80%
* Peaceful work environment: Player has a happiness of 50% or more
help_employee_demands_equipment_content:
As part of their Wants and Demands, some employees will demand certain equipment.
* [Executive Office Desk (Left)](furniture-officedesk2left)
* [Executive Office Desk (Right)](furniture-officedesk2right)
* [Cheap Coffee Machine](furniture-cheapcoffeemachine)
* [Classic Phone](furniture-classicphone)
* [Computer Monitor](furniture-computermonitor)
* [Graphic Tablet](furniture-graphictablet)
* [Graphic Tablet (with Screen)](furniture-graphictabletwithscreen)
* [Meeting Table (Large)](furniture-largemeetingtable)
* [Mouse Pad](furniture-mousepad)
* [Multipurpose Chair](furniture-multipurposechair)
* [Office Chair](furniture-officechair)
* [Office Phone](furniture-officephone)
* [Sofa](furniture-sofagroup)
* [Standard Fridge](furniture-standardfridge)
* [Standard Office Desk](furniture-officedesk1)
* [Stump Mesh Office Chair](furniture-officechair2)
* [Water Cooler](itemname_watercooler)
help_employee_demands_schedule_content:
**Setting the Employee's Schedule**

Once you have assigned the employee to a business in the [MyEmployees](skill-myemployees) app on your [BizPhone](general-bizphone), visit the BizMan page for that business and click on the "Schedule" tab.

From there, click-and-drag the employee's name to the employee workstation below the schedule. From there, you can adjust the hours and days you want them to work.

**Schedule Demands**

As part of their Wants and Demands, some employees will demand a certain schedule.
* Part-time: Between 10 and 30 hours per week
* Full-time: Between 30 and 50 hours per week
* Four days week: Assigned to work 4 days a week
* Five days week: Assigned to work 5 days a week
* No morning shifts: No shifts assigned between 06:00 (6 AM) and 10:00 (10 AM)
* No afternoon shifts: No shifts assigned between 14:00 (2 PM) and 16:00 (4 PM)
* No evening shifts: No shifts assigned between 18:00 (6 PM) and 22:00 (10 PM)
* No night shifts: No shifts assigned between 22:00 (10 PM) and 04:00 (4 AM)
* Free Weekends: No Saturdays/Sundays shifts
* No cleaning shifts: No cleaning shifts assigned
help_employee_demands_benefits_healthins:
**Health Insurance**

To set up Health Insurance, perform the following steps:
* Visit the Hospital and talk to the [Health Insurance Manager](address: 0 7s)
* Choose an [HR Manager](skill-hrmanager) and a level of Insurance: Gold, Silver, Bronze
* The Health Insurance Manager will soon send a text message with an offer.
* You can Accept, Reject, or Negotiate this offer.

Once you accept, the employees assigned to the HR Manager will be covered by the chosen plan.

Note: 
* HR Manager skill determines what level of insurance they can request
* You will be charged for a minimum of 10 employees
* You will be charged daily for this plan 
* Your HR Manager can upgrade their plan at any time on their BizMan app on your [BizPhone](general-bizphone)

help_bizphone_econoview_content:
The *EconoView App* shows you all your financial information.

 **Latest Transactions**

This section will show you your recent transations. Click "Full Transactions View" to search or export your most recent transactions.

**Loans / Investments**

This section allows you to manage your [Loans and Investments](finance-banks).

**Income Statement**

This section shows your income and expenses breakdown of the last several days. If you click on a business name, you can see the specific income breakdown for that business.

Note: the income statement shows you how profitable your business is, including the cost of the inventory. But since you previously paid for that inventory, that amount is not actually deducted again from your income, it is only used to show the overall profitability.
help_building_types_content:
Each building has a code that indicates its layout, size, and customer/vehicle capacity.

**Retail**
* **A1**: 75m (807ft) / 15 customer capacity
* **A2**: 75m (807ft) / 15 customer capacity
* **C1**: 225m (2422ft) / 30 customer capacity
* **C2**: 225m (2422ft) / 30 customer capacity
* **D2**: 285m (3068ft) / 40 customer capacity
* **M1**: 1000m (10764ft) / 75 customer capacity

**Office**
* **A3**: 75m (807ft) / 4 customer capacity
* **C1**: 225m (2422ft) / 8 customer capacity
* **C2**: 225m (2422ft) / 8 customer capacity
* **D2**: 285m (3068ft) / 10 customer capacity
* **J1**: 285m (3068ft) / 10 customer capacity
* **K1**: 660m (7104ft) / 50 customer capacity

**Warehouse / Factory**
* **H1**: 690m (7427ft) / 1 vehicle capacity
* **H2**: 690m (7427ft) / 1 vehicle capacity
* **H3**: 690m (7427ft) / 1 vehicle capacity
* **I1**: 1292m (13907ft) / 2 vehicle capacity
* **I2**: 1292m (13907ft) / 2 vehicle capacity
* **I3**: 1292m (13907ft) / 2 vehicle capacity

**Residential**
* **B1**: 54m (581ft)
* **F1**: 96m (1033ft)
* **L1**: 204m (2196ft)
* **N1**: 589m (6340ft)
help_building_traffic_content:
When you combine **Traffic Index and Marketing** you get your overall promotion for your business. You want to reach 100% promotion to maximize your potential customers.

Traffic Index cannot be altered, so it's important to choose a building with a high index when renting a building for your new business. Using your [BizPhone](general-bizphone) apps, you can see the building's Traffic Index either in BizMan or Voogle Maps

Marketing can be used to supplement your Traffic Index to increase your Promotion. Different building sizes will require different amounts of marketing, so you'll need to find the right combination of marketing for each business.

You can get marketing campaigns from the following locations:
* [McCain's eMarketing](address:17 3a)
* [CityAds](address:5 2a)
help_building_limit_content:
Each building has a maximum **Customer Capacity** building limit, this is the maximum number of customers you can get per hour.
* Depending on the [Building Type](building-types), the Customer Capacity can range from 4-75.

However, each furniture item only adds its own Customer Capacity. So in order to reach the Building Limit, you might need multiple of the same furniture item.
* For instance, if a piece of furniture has a customer capacity of 10, and your building limit is 30, you will need 3 of that furniture item to reach the building limit.

Keep in mind, if any furniture item's capacity is below the building's maximum capacity, it will limit the entire store's maximum Customer Capacity.
help_building_interiordesigner_content:
While inside your building, click the **Interior Designer** button to enter Interior Design mode.

This gives you access to a series of tools to manage your building.

**Hand / Move**
Move and rotate items in your building. Click on any object to move it around.

**Eyedropper**
Copy and paste custom colors from one item to another. After selecting the tool, click on an item to copy the colors of that item. Click on other items to paste those colors.

To copy a new color, click on the tool again, or press ESC to reset the tool. You can also use this tool to copy a wall or floor design.

**Color Pallet**
Manually set the color of any item. Click on any item in your building to recolor it.

**Undo & Redo**
Undo or redo any action in the Interior Designer mode. This will also refund design purchases or undo any items sold with the Interior Designer.

*Note:* When you close Interior Designer mode, all changes are locked and you can no longer undo / redo.

**Sell**
Sell items in your building. Click on any item to sell it.

*Note:* Everything attached to the item will also be sold. Example: If you sell a desk, it will sell the computer, chair and everything on the desk

**Floors & Walls**
Alter the designs of the floors and walls. Choose a floor or wall style, then click and drag the mouse to "paint" that design where you want it.

Changing the wall and floor designs costs money, and impacts the "Interior" score of the building.

**Customer Queue**
Customize your customer queues for things like Points of Sales or Coat Checks. Click on the register to see the queue anchor points.

You can add or move anchor points to make the queue follow a more complicated path around your building. Right-click on any anchor point to delete that point.

**Security Cameras**
Quickly identify any items that aren't covered by the security camera, so you can adjust the cameras for full coverage to improve your building's [security](building-security).

**Product Selector**
Easily access and adjust the dropdown menus to select which products should be sold in your store's display cases.

**Time of Day**
Preview your building at different times of the day. By dragging the slider left or right, you can preview what your building's decorations will look like at different times of the day.

**Save Blueprint**
Once you are done decorating your store, you can save a [blueprint](building-blueprints) of the building you're currently in. Click this button, give the blueprint a name and save it!
help_building_blueprints_content:
**Blueprints** can be found in the Esc Menu or Main Menu.

**My Library**

When you save a blueprint, it goes to the My Library tab. This is where you can manage/delete your local blueprints as well as any blueprints you have downloaded from the community.

If you would like to share your blueprints with the Big Ambitions community, you can upload your blueprints to the Steam Gallery.

**Steam Gallery**

 From here you can browse and download blueprints from other community members to your own Library. You will need to download a blueprint before using an [Installation Firm](building-interiorinstallationfirms) to install it in your own business.

 *Note:* Each blueprint can only work in buildings of the exact same layout and size, so an A1 blueprint cannot be used in an A2 building.
help_building_installationfirms_content:
**Installation Firms** are used to setup and install layouts into your buildings. You can use their default layouts, or a [Blueprint](building-blueprints) from your library.

After agreeing to their services for a significant base fee, plus the cost of each item, the installation will be set up for the day you select.

On that day, the business will be inaccessible until the installation is complete. Any items in the building will be sold and the price will be deducted from the total, or refunded to you if the total exceeds the amount you owe.

* [Kingdom Office](address: 43 4a) installs blueprints into your office buildings
* [Kristian Bahood](address: 2 1a) installs blueprints into your retail and warehouse buildings
* [Nugem Interiors](address: 11 1a) installs blueprints into your residential buildings

Visit the agent at the installation firm to schedule your interior installation.
help_building_security_content:
**Security and Theft** impact your retail stores.

Unfortunately, if you leave your retail stores unguarded, you will start to lose some inventory each day - especially for your jewelry stores, which can be quite devastating!

Check the BizMan app on your [BizPhone](general-bizphone) to see your current security level. Fortunately, you can raise that score using these security features:

**Security Panels**

[Security Panels](furniture-securitypanel) can be placed on either side of the front doors.

A pair of panels will be enough to protect smaller stores with lower value inventory.

**Cameras**

Wall-Mounted [Security Cameras](furniture-securitycamera) and Ceiling-Mounted [Security Cameras (Dome)](furniture-securitycameraroof) can be placed around your store to secure items within their visibility range. Items in the view of cameras have a very low chance of being stolen, even if the building is less than 100% secure.

Larger stores with more valuable inventory may need a combination of Cameras and Security Panels.

**Security Guards**

Place a [Security Guard Locker](furniture-securityguardlocker) somewhere in your store to assign a [Security Guard](skill-securityguard) to your store's schedule.

For stores with the most valuable inventory, you'll need two fully-trained Security Guards to keep your valuables completely protected. This impacts products from stores such as:
* [Jewelry Stores](businesstypes-jewelrystore)
* [Electronics Stores](businesstypes-electronicsstore)
* [Clothing Stores](businesstypes-clothingstore)
help_building_customerdemands_content:
Customers will begin to make demands about your stores. If you don't want to risk losing customers, make sure you pay attention to what they are saying.

You can monitor **Customer Satisfaction** in the BizMan App on the Insights page of your [BizPhone](general-bizphone). Keep in mind that it might take a few days for the customers to adjust to your changes.

**Customer Service**:
This is a measurement of how well your employees are taking care of the customers. Employees with higher skill and satisfaction provide a better experience for the customer.

Use your [MyEmployees App](skill-myemployees) to train your employees and see their demands.

**Pricing:**
If you alter your prices, you can monitor the customers' reaction here.

The highest acceptable price depends on which district you're in, the current lowest price in the district, and your employee's skill and satisfaction levels.

**Interior:**
* **Interior Design**: Customers like a store with nice wall and floor designs. Use the [Interior Design](building-interiordesigner) mode in your store to improve it
* **Music**: Customers enjoy listening to music while they shop. There are several [Music Options](furniture-musicgroup) for you to play music
* **Trash**: If the customers have garbage they need somewhere to throw it away! Place a [Trash Bin](furniture-trashbin) in your store to solve this problem.
* **Seating**: If customers have food to eat, they'll want a place to sit down. Place enough [Restaurant Booth](furniture-restaurantbooth) or [Dining Table](furniture-diningtablegroup) to provide them seating.
* **Uniforms**: Set employee uniforms in the [MyEmployees App](skill-myemployees) on the [BizPhone](general-bizphone)

**Cleanliness:**
The more customers and employees you have moving around the store, the dirtier it will get.

Use a [Cleaning Station](furniture-cleaningstation) to clean or assign a cleaning employee.
help_businesstype_hairdresser_content:
**Hairdressers** are retail businesses. 

Customers are served by employees.

The business requires the following furniture to function:

* [Cash Register](furniture-cashregister)
* [Hairdresser Shelf](furniture-hairdressershelf)
* [Hairdresser Chair](furniture-hairdresserchair) or [Hairdresser Chair (Modern)](furniture-hairdresserchairmodern)
* [Hairdresser Head Wash](furniture-hairdresserheadwash)
* [Hair Care Product](products-haircareproduct)

Businesses of this type primarily sell:

* [Hair Chemical / Color Fee](fees-hairchemicalfee)
* [Hair Cutting Fee](fees-haircuttingfee)
* [Hair Shampooing & Blowout Fee](fees-hairshampooingfee)
* [Hair Styling Fee](fees-hairstylingfee)

And can additionally sell:

* [Hair Care Product](products-haircareproduct)

Employees with the following skills can be assigned:

* [Hair Stylist](skill-hairstylist)
* [Customer Service](skill-customerservice)
* [Cleaning](skill-cleaning)
help_businesstype_nightclub_content:
**Nightclubs** are retail businesses. 

Customers are served by employees.

The business requires the following furniture to function:

* [Cash Register](furniture-cashregister)
* [Coat Check (Left)](furniture-coatcheckleft) or [Coat Check (Right)](furniture-coatcheckright)
* [DJ Booth](furniture-djbooth)
* [Speaker](furniture-musicgroup)
* At least one product to sell (see below)

Businesses of this type primarily sell:

* [Beer](products-beer)
* [Coat Check Fee](fees-coatcheckfee)
* [Cover Charge](fees-covercharge)
* [Margarita](products-margarita)
* [Martini](products-martini)
* [Whisky](products-whisky)

And can additionally sell:

* [Soda Can](products-sodacan)

Employees with the following skills can be assigned:

* [DJ](skill-dj)
* [Customer Service](skill-customerservice)
* [Cleaning](skill-cleaning)
help_itemname_beer_content:
**Beer** is a type of product primarily sold from [Nightclubs](businesstypes-nightclub) and [Liquor Stores](businesstypes-liquorstore).

The product can be placed in the following furniture, based on the type of store.

 **[Nightclubs](businesstypes-nightclub)**: 
* [Cocktail Bar (Beer Shelf)](furniture-cocktailbarbeershelf) 
* [Cocktail Bar (Beer Shelf Wooden)](furniture-woodencocktailbarbeershelf)

 **[Liquor Stores](businesstypes-liquorstore)**: 
* [Drinks Shelf](furniture-drinksshelf)

The product can be purchased from the following locations:
* [NY Distro Inc](address:37 1s)

The product can be imported from the following locations:
* [United Ocean Import](address: 3 pier)

The product can be manufactured using the following recipes:
* [Beer Recipe](recipes-beerrecipe)
help_itemname_coatcheckfee_content:
**Coat Check Fee** is collected from customers when they enter a [Nightclubs](businesstypes-nightclub) business and give their coat or jacket to an employee to store in the Coat Check area.

To collect this fee, the following is required:
* [Coat Check (Left)](furniture-coatcheckleft) or [Coat Check (Right)](furniture-coatcheckright)
* [Customer Service Employee](skill-customerservice)
help_itemname_covercharge_content:
**Cover Charge** is a fee collected from customers when they enter [Nightclubs](businesstypes-nightclub).

The fee comes in two varieties: 
* Weekday Cover Charge
* Weekend Cover Charge

Nothing is required to collect this fee, it happens automatically when customers enter the business.
help_itemname_haircareproduct_content:
**Hair Care Product** is a type of product primarily sold from [Hairdressers](businesstypes-hairdresser).

**Note:** Hair Care Products are also used by [Hair Stylist](skill-hairstylist) to perform any service.

The product can be placed in the following furniture:
* [Hairdresser Shelf](furniture-hairdressershelf)

The product can be purchased from the following locations:
* [NY Distro Inc](address:37 1s)

The product can be imported from the following locations:
* [JetCargo Imports](address: 1 pier)
help_itemname_hairchemicalfee_content:
**Hair Chemical Fee** is collected from customers when they enter a [Hairdresser](businesstypes-hairdresser) business and choose that service.

To collect this fee, the following is required:
* [Hairdresser Chair](furniture-hairdresserchair) or [Hairdresser Chair (Modern)](furniture-hairdresserchairmodern)
* [Hair Stylist](skill-hairstylist)
* [Hair Care Product](products-haircareproduct)
help_itemname_haircuttingfee_content:
**Hair Cutting Fee** is collected from customers when they enter a [Hairdresser](businesstypes-hairdresser) business and choose that service.

To collect this fee, the following is required:
* [Hairdresser Chair](furniture-hairdresserchair) or [Hairdresser Chair (Modern)](furniture-hairdresserchairmodern)
* [Hair Stylist](skill-hairstylist)
* [Hair Care Product](products-haircareproduct)
help_itemname_hairshampooingfee_content:
**Hair Shampooing & Blowout Fee** is collected from customers when they enter a [Hairdresser](businesstypes-hairdresser) business and choose that service.

To collect this fee, the following is required:
* [Hairdresser Head Wash](furniture-hairdresserheadwash)
* [Hair Stylist](skill-hairstylist)

help_itemname_icecream_content:

The product can be placed in the following furniture, based on the type of store:
* [Fast Food Restaurant](businesstypes-fastfoodrestaurant) or [Coffee Shop](businesstypes-coffeeshop) use [Ice Cream Counter](furniture-icecreamcounter)
* [Supermarket](businesstypes-supermarket) uses [Industrial Freezer](furniture-industrialfreezer) or [Industrial Freezer (Small)](furniture-smallindustrialfreezer) 

The product can be purchased from the following locations:
* [NY Distro Inc](address:37 1s)

The product can be imported from the following locations:

help_skillname_dj_content:
Employees with the **DJ** skill are used for nightclubs.

DJs play music and keep the customers dancing and spending more money.

The skill level (%) defines how long customers stay in the nightclub.

They can be assigned to:
* [DJ Booth](furniture-djbooth)

They can be hired from:
* [Anderson Recruitment Corp.](address: 16 5a)
help_skillname_hairstylist_content:
Employees with the **Hair Stylist** skill are used for hairdressers.

Hair Stylists earn money from customers by offering a variety of hair treatments:
* [Hair Chemical / Color Fee](fees-hairchemicalfee)
* [Hair Cutting Fee](fees-haircuttingfee)
* [Hair Shampooing & Blowout Fee](fees-hairshampooingfee)
* [Hair Styling Fee](fees-hairstylingfee)

The skill level (%) defines how quickly they are able to style each customer.

They can be assigned to:
* [Hairdresser Chair](furniture-hairdresserchair)
* [Hairdresser Chair (Modern)](furniture-hairdresserchairmodern)
* [Hairdresser Headwash](furniture-hairdresserheadwash)

They can be hired from:
* [Anderson Recruitment Corp.](address: 16 5a)
help_skillname_headhunter_content:
Employees with the **Headhunter** skill are used for headquarters.

Similiar to the Recruitment Offices, headhunters can recruit employees, with more filter options based on their skill level. You can set a target number of candidates to recruit, or let them recruit until you stop them.

Additionally, you can connect them with HR Managers, and for every employee assigned to that HR Manager, the Headhunter will provide a automatic replacement worker when they are poached (within 3-5 days), resign (within 1 day), or retire (instantly). 

The skill level (%) defines how quickly they recruit, how many HR Managers they can supervise and how closely the replacement employees match the employee they are replacing.

They can be assigned to:
* [Computer Workstation](furniture-computerworkstation)

They can be hired from:
* [City Workforce Inc.](address: 41 4a)
help_skillname_securityguard_content:
Employees with the **Security Guard** skill are used in any retail location.

Security Guards each manage 1 Security Guard Locker and prevent theft from occuring.

The skill level (%) defines how effective their security is.

They can be assigned to:
* [Security Guard Locker](furniture-securityguardlocker)

They can be hired from:
* [Anderson Recruitment Corp.](address: 16 5a)
help_bizphone_myemployees_content:
The *MyEmployees App* lets you manage your employees and recruits.

**Employees**

You can manage all of your hired employees in this menu. From here you can see their current age, wage, skill levels, satisfaction, business assignment, demands, uniforms and more.

**Candidates**

You can manage any new recruits in this tab.

You can assign them to a business, hire them, or reject potential employees. If you don't take action before the offer expires, they will automatically be deleted from the list. 

Recruits can come from the following sources:

* [Anderson Recruitment Corp.](address: 16 5a)
* [City Workforce Inc.](address: 41 4a)
* [Headhunter](skill-headhunter) Employee

**Employee Actions**

Select an employee to get more details about that employee.

From there, you can pay the employee a bonus, assign uniforms, assign current business, or send the employee to training.

**Mass Employee Actions**

You can select multiple Employees or Candidates by clicking on the checkmark next to their name. Shift-click to select multiple employees in a row.

Once your employees are selected, you can use the drop-down menu up top to apply an action to all the selected employees.
help_itemname_computerworkstation_conten:
**Computer Workstation** is a special *employee station* for office-based employees.
* [Graphic Designer](skill-graphicdesigner)
* [Headhunter](skill-headhunter)
* [HR Manager](skill-hrmanager)
* [Lawyer](skill-lawyer)
* [Logistics Manager](skill-logisticsmanager)
* [Purchasing Agent](skill-purchasingagent)
* [Programmer](skill-programmer)

It requires a [Desk](furniture-deskgroup) and a [Chair](furniture-chairgroup) and a [Computer](furniture-computergroup)

To accomodate some employee demands, you can add additional items such as:
* [Classic Phone](furniture-classicphone)

help_wholesalers_shortages_content:
**Shortages and Backorders** can either happen naturally from time to time or can be artificially created by [Rivals](rivals-overview) who are competing with you.

If an item is on a *Shortage*, the price for that item will increase, but you will still be able to purchase it.

If an item is on a *Backorder*, you will not be able to purchase that item until the backorder ends.

In both cases, customer demand will increase for the duration since the item is in limited supply. If you are able to keep enough items in storage to last through a shortage, you could make a nice boost in income!
help_wholesalers_overview_content:
**Purchasing From a Wholesaler**

In order to sell goods at your store, you must first purchase those goods from a wholesaler or importer. Visit any wholesale location to purchase bulk boxes of inventory.

**Delivering to Your Stores**

In order to receive deliveries, first make sure your store has at least one [Storage Shelf](furniture-storageshelf).

You can set up deliveries from any of the wholesalers by speaking to the manager at the desk in the store.

After setting up the contract with the manager, you can manage your weekly deliveries in the Deliveries tab of the BizMan app on your [BizPhone](general-bizphone).

Wholesalers include:
* [Metro Wholesale](wholesalers-metro)
* [NY Distro Inc](wholesalers-nydistro)
* [Total Produce Trading](wholesalers-totalproduce)
* [Hudson Wholesale](address:13 12s)

help_vehicletypename_alternatetravelopti:
If you don't want to buy a car and deal with parking and traffic, there are a few options:

**Taxis** 

Taxis randomly drive through the city ready to drive you around for a fee.

When one is near you, click on it and select the building you'd like to travel to.

**Subway Stations**

Subway Stations are in various locations around the city.

When you are near a subway station, click on it, then click on another subway station to travel there for a fee.

**Electric Scooters**

Electric Scooters are found charging in various locations around the city.

For a fee, you can rent these scooters.

*Note:* You can hold a paper bag but you cannot carry boxes or use any hand trucks or flatbeds while using the electric scooter.

help_businesstype_electronicsstore_conte:
**Electronics Stores** are retail businesses. 

Customers are self-serving.

The business requires the following furniture to function:

* [Stack of Shopping Baskets](furniture-stackofshoppingbaskets)
* [Point of Sales](furniture-itemgrouppointofsale)
* At least one product to sell (see below)

Businesses of this type primarily sell:

* [Arty Fish Phone](products-smartphone1)
* [Arty Fish Smartwatch](products-smartwatch2)
* [Noize Boss Earbuds](products-earbuds01)
* [Rhythm By Tre](products-headphones01)
* [ZanaMan Phone](products-smartphone2)
* [ZanaMan Smartwatch](products-smartwatch1)

And can additionally sell:

* [Soda Can](products-sodacan)

Employees with the following skills can be assigned:

* [Customer Service](skill-customerservice)
* [Cleaning](skill-cleaning)

rivals_jessica_johnson_activation: What the... Listen, kid, I was hoping this wouldn't happen. I really like Fred, but that's not gonna hold me back from defending my own freaking neighborhood. Get out of Hell's Kitchen. It's mine.
rivals_jessica_johnson_deactivation: All right. I see what you did, kid. Respect for backing off. Now stay chill in Hell's Kitchen. All right. There are plenty of other neighborhoods.
rivals_jessica_johnson_entrance: Hey, kid. That's what Fred always calls you, right, kid? That's cute. Anyway, have fun with your little business, but don't give me any reason to worry about you, all right? Keep it small, kid.
rivals_jessica_johnson_hirebestemployees: We did some research yesterday. Actually. We were looking online to see who works for you. We found some really skilled people. Might be time for them to get a raise and maybe a new employer.
rivals_jessica_johnson_lowdemand: I just had a great idea I wanted to share with you. What if I expanded all of my businesses' inventory with exactly what you're selling? Imagine what will happen with the demand. Imagine how hard it would be for you to keep up your revenue. That's a real good idea, I think.
rivals_jessica_johnson_pricereduction: I had my mole visit your silly little business. Prices must be turning a nice profit, right? Imagine where your customers will go when they hear about my prices. Bye sugar.
rivals_jessica_johnson_productshortage: Guess who went shopping last night? Me. Guess what I purchased? Yes, all of your favorite products. You know what a product shortage means, right? Well, I'm sure your customers will the next time you go to the wholesaler.
rivals_jessica_johnson_rentrivalbuilding: Come on, kid, you're not that slow. Trying to rent one of my buildings to expand your little empire and compete with me, seriously? Come on.
rivals_jessica_johnson_surrender: All right, you win. Jeez, you just have no respect, huh? I've been controlling Hell's Kitchen for ten years. Then you just come waltzing in, acting like the boss. No kidding Fred is your uncle. Goodbye... for now.
rivals_ingrid_schneider_activation: This is really unacceptable. Another business? You suddenly forgot who owns this neighborhood. I'm not looking for more rivals. I would rather destroy them. So you should consider if it's better business to shut down your own business.
rivals_ingrid_schneider_deactivation: Ahhh, sehr gut! You know, sometimes you don’t know what you’re up against, until it bites you. I respect you changed your mind. Let’s keep it that way.
rivals_ingrid_schneider_entrance: Hello! I see you opened a business in our neighborhood, Garment District. Listen junge, you’re more than welcome here, but remember who owns this neighborhood. So don’t get any big ideas. Tschüss!
rivals_ingrid_schneider_hirebestemployee: I assume you’re very happy with your most skilled staff right? Well, mal schauen. I've got my eye on them. So I bet they are going to be really interested in hearing the salary I’m offering, compared to your little establishment.
rivals_ingrid_schneider_lowdemand: Oh yeah, you probably feel really clever, opening your little businesses based on demands, right? You think I don’t have the capital to flood the market with the products you sell? You should keep an eye on demand, mein liebling, because you might not even be able to see it when I'm done with you.
rivals_ingrid_schneider_pricereduction: Really? Someone thinks they can compete with my prices? Da hast du dich aber geschnitten, mein Schatz. I'll slash my prices and knock your profit margins down. Customers are going to flock to me. Mach dich bereit, because things are about to get real tough, Liebes.
rivals_ingrid_schneider_productshortage: Hey! Nicht so schnell, Schätzchen. I've got a little surprise for you. Have you visited your favorite wholesaler recently? If not, you’ll see a sudden shortage of all your favorite products. Good luck making a profit, mein Liebling.
rivals_ingrid_schneider_rentrivalbuildin: Haha, that's ridiculous. You trying to rent one of my buildings to expand on your laughable little enterprise? Forget about it! Sei nicht albern mein liebling!
rivals_ingrid_schneider_surrender: Ah, you're so annoying. You're really never going to give up, are you? Well, I'm calling to say that Garment District is yours, so congratulations, I guess. You know what? I don't even care. My business in New York has always just been secondary for me. My empire remains in Berlin, and I hope I will never have to see you again. Auf wiedersehen, für immer.
rivals_thierry_laurent_moreau_activation: Hmmmmm! I thought I told you very clearly: don't get too ambitious in Murray Hill, compris? I thought we could stay good friends. But not if you're planning to take over my neighborhood. Until you shut down one of your businesses, expect to feel my anger!
rivals_thierry_laurent_moreau_deactivati: Mon ami, I am glad to see you changed your mind. And we can stay friends. Now you are not bothering me. I'll stop bothering you. Mm. Pas fait pour tout le monde. Bonne journée.
rivals_thierry_laurent_moreau_entrance: Bonjour, mon ami, and welcome to Murray Hill. We at TLM Enterprise always welcome new businesses. Just remember, don't get too ambitious and we will stay good friends. Au revoir, a bientôt.
rivals_thierry_laurent_moreau_hirebestem: Ooh la la. Your star employee. Mine now, huh? They will see the light and jump ship. Enjoy your low skilled replacements while I seduce your top staff.
rivals_thierry_laurent_moreau_lowdemand: Écoute. Do you know why you are able to sell your products at such a high price? Du monde. Mon ami, see, du monde. You know what happens if I keep opening similar businesses? Selling the same products? Mm. Exactement. Bon voyage de monde. Bon voyage.
rivals_thierry_laurent_moreau_pricereduc: Let's see how strong your bank account really is. Good luck competing with the rock bottom prices I am offering now. Say au revoir to profits, my friend.
rivals_thierry_laurent_moreau_productsho: Hahahahaha! Incapable of keeping up with the demand, aren't you? Huh? It's no coincidence, as most of those products you like to sell are now in my warehouse. Have fun paying over-price at the wholesalers.
rivals_thierry_laurent_moreau_rentrivalb: No no, no. No more renting my properties for you, my friend. Consider it a favor. Mm. And now scram, and find some rundown hole to hide in. C'est moi qui contrôle les prime spots. Mon ami.
rivals_thierry_laurent_moreau_surrender: Ah, I see the numbers. I am not stupid. Bravo! Bravo! On pushing me out on my own neighborhood. I never liked the city anyway. I always dreamt of going back to Paris. You finally gave me a reason to. And if I ever see you open as much as a food truck en France... Don't even think about it. Au revoir.
rivals_huang_guo_activation: Hey! An act of war. That's what it is when you keep opening up businesses in Midtown. Are you ready to feel the rage of Huang? You should be, because it is on like a donkey in the Kong. Okay. Good, good.
rivals_huang_guo_deactivation: Maybe you're not as stupid as I initially thought. Good choice. Backing off. Okay, good, good. Get out. Good.
rivals_huang_guo_entrance: Ah, welcome, my friend. Welcome to Midtown. This is the most prestigious neighborhood in the city of Manhattan. And we at Guo Investments, we strongly recommend that we avoid any conflicts of interest. Do you understand? That means understanding who runs things in town. Okay. Good, good.
rivals_huang_guo_hirebestemployees: Ah, my colleague. I have some exciting plans for today. I'm planning to message all of your most skilled employees. I'll message them saying: Hello. Do you want same job, but much better pay? Yes? Good.
rivals_huang_guo_lowdemand: Hello my friend. This is a Huang talking. He's the guy who's now selling all the products you sell too. And I don't care about the huge drop in demand. But I'm sure you do. Okay. Toodle, toodle. Bye. Good.
rivals_huang_guo_pricereduction: Oh, hello, my friend. Just a quick heads up. Okay. We have a big discount in all of my stores, and we sell everything you sell. But like with the baby birds: Cheap, cheap. Cheaper. Good.
rivals_huang_guo_productshortage: Yeah. You know what's really bad for business? Low profit margins. That's why my staff is currently driving around the city of Manhattan buying all the products you like to sell. So you can look forward to much higher wholesale prices. Okay, good. Shake your head down and up. Good.
rivals_huang_guo_rentrivalbuilding: Or you want to rent one of my buildings in my neighborhood. Huh? How about, uh, I loan you my car? Or you could borrow my wife. Huh? Or maybe you want to borrow my shoes. Oh, wait. You wouldn't survive a day in them. Especially my wife. Forget about it.
rivals_huang_guo_surrender: I still don't understand how this happened. Do you know someone at City Hall? Government? I bet you do. Oh, cheat! I'm going back to Beijing and don't ever think about visiting, okay? Not good. Very not good.
rivals_poach_employee_offer: Hey boss. This isn't easy to say, but I got a really good offer to work for {rivalName}, and I am strongly considering it. However, if you're able to match an hourly wage of {amount}, I will gladly stay here with you. I've got {days} days to make my decision.
rivals_poach_employee_accept: Most excellent! I look forward to continuing my time working for you!
rivals_poach_employee_decline: That's disappointing to hear, but with that decision I will be moving on! Thank you, goodbye!
rivals_poach_employee_expired: Well, I haven't heard back from you, so I am going to take that as a sign from the universe that it's time to continue my journey somewhere else.
rivals_poach_employee_rival_surrender: I've heard that {rivalName} is out of business, so I've decided to keep working for you. I wouldn't mind that raise, though.
rivals_poach_employee_raise_accepted: Wow, I didn't expect you to actually give me that raise! I'm really happy to continue working for you. Thanks!
rivals_poach_employee_raise_declined: It was worth a shot, but I'm glad I can continue working for you. See you at work!
notification_cannot_rent_building_owned_: The building owner, your Rival {name}, has declined your offer to rent their building
bizman_presentation_deposit: Deposit - the initial deposit which gets returned at the end of the contract
bizman_presentation_electrical_appliance: Electrical Appliances - the cost of the electrical appliances included in the building
bizman_presentation_first_day_rent: First Day's Rent - the first daily rent payment
